common_issues.title: Pieces software encountering errors on Windows
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Windows report various errors with Pieces software, including processing failures in the desktop app, LTM issues in the CLI, and connection problems with the Chrome plugin.  Issues range from general errors to specific feature malfunctions.  Users have provided screenshots and logs. Further investigation is needed to determine root cause and solutions.

related_issues.title: Failed to connect to PiecesOS
related_issues.text:
Failed to connect to PiecesOS
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome plugin doesn't work properly. I can't use the buttons and features, and the sidebar cannot establish connection either. Inside of Pieces desktop app it shows that the chrome plugin is outdated. However this is the newest I got from the chrome app store.

Plugin version: 4.0.9

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and plugin connection and functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with PiecesOS and its Chrome plugin. Issues include installation problems on Chromebooks with screen flickering and unresponsive buttons, plugin connection failures and outdated version messages on Windows, and general processing errors.  Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and provide solutions across different operating systems and plugin versions.

related_issues.title: Installation issue in cromebook
related_issues.text:
Installation issue in cromebook
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There are some issues with the Chromebook. When installing core dependencies, the screen flickers, and it takes a long time to buffer. Once loaded, you can't click any buttons, like the "Get Started" button. It just gets stuck on that page.
also it has issue with full screen you can to anything unless minimize

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and plugin connection issues
common_issues.description: Users report various connection problems with Pieces OS and its plugins across different operating systems (Linux, Windows). Issues include "No available configurations for RGBA pixel format" error on Linux, general connection failures on Windows, and Chrome plugin malfunctions with reported outdated versions despite being the latest from the store.  Further investigation into plugin compatibility and Pieces OS connection stability is needed.

related_issues.title: Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
related_issues.text:
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
### Software

Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Whenever I am trying to start Pieces OS or Pieces For Developers via the Linux Terminal, or via VS Code Plug-In (I don't use / haven't tried other ways), the following error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b7cc5de-7fdd-4a36-99f2-c806a7e540d6)


Information about my system:

```
inxi -G
Graphics:
  Device-1: NVIDIA GP107 [GeForce GTX 1050 Ti] driver: nvidia v: 535.183.01
  Display: x11 server: X.Org v: 1.21.1.7 with: Xwayland v: 22.1.9 driver: X:
    loaded: nvidia unloaded: fbdev,modesetting,nouveau,vesa gpu: nvidia
    resolution: 1680x1050~60Hz
  API: OpenGL v: 4.6.0 NVIDIA 535.183.01 renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
    Ti/PCIe/SSE2
```

```
uname -a
Linux debian 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Thanks in a advance!

common_issues.title: LTM Issues Across Different Pieces Platforms
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Long Term Memory (LTM) functionality, including LTM turning off intermittently on macOS, LTM not working in the Pieces CLI on Windows, and general LTM processing errors on Windows. Issues appear across different Pieces OS versions. Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.
